section_title: Medial Patellofemoral Ligament Reconstruction (Evidence: pg no: 12, L576)
names: Medial patellofemoral ligament reconstruction (Evidence: pg no: 12, L577)
description: Medial patellofemoral ligament reconstruction when specific criteria apply (Evidence: pg no: 12, L577-L587)
scope: Treatment of patellofemoral instability (Evidence: pg no: 12, L576-L587)

documentation: EITHER performed in combination with distal realignment for patellofemoral instability OR ALL of the following criteria: Recurrent patellofemoral instability with pain that limits function OR failure of at least 12 weeks of conservative management, Radiographic imaging consistent with Kellgren-Lawrence grade 2 or lower patellofemoral osteoarthritis, and Presence of tibial tubercle-trochlear groove distance < 20 mm, normal trochlear morphology, and absence of patella alta (Evidence: pg no: 12, L579-L587)
